definition: public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Malta holds a referendum on whether to allow divorce.
sentences.chinese: 马耳他就是否允许离婚举行全民公决。

sentences.english: The country voted for self-rule in a November referendum.
sentences.chinese: 去年十一月，该国为自治问题举行了全民公决。

sentences.english: President Kaunda fulfilled his promise of announcing a date for the referendum.
sentences.chinese: 卡翁达总统兑现了他的承诺，宣布了全民公决的日期。

definition: referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
lower chamber (of legislative body)/lower house/the House of Commons
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
